title: Introduction to sps
text: page, provide introduction sps package (5 minute read). Specifically, explain two main functions. sps: Synthetic Purposive Sampling select study sites multi-site causal studies. sps_estimator: Synthetic Purposive Sampling Estimator estimate average-site average treatment effect (ATEs) multi-site causal studies.

title: Introduction to sps
text: use multi-country survey experiment attitudes toward immigrants (Naumann et al, 2018) example . example, define 15 European countries population sites. site-level variables, consider 7 variables discussed original paper: GDP, size migrant population, unemployment rates, general support immigration, proportion females, mean age, mean income. practice, recommended standardize variable make scale site-level variables comparable. , variable mean zero standard deviation one. Users can use sps_plot() visualize distribution site-level variables site selection.  can use sps select diverse sites population sites. select 6 sites 15 European countries example.1 start basic version sps illustrate refinements different pages (e.g., stratified SPS). example, sps selected following 6 sites. Users can investigate selected sites visually. Red triangles represent selected sites black circles represent non-selected sites. last row diagonal plots, users can see marginal distribution variable. remaining figures middle show bivariate relationships two variables. can see selected sites successfully cover wide range values site-level variable.  necessary, users can refine site selection using stratification make sure selected sites satisfy certain conditions. stratification can help users incorporate various practical, logistical, ethical constraints. Please see AAA.

title: Introduction to sps
text: focus multi-site causal study researchers (experimental observational) identification strategies internal validity within site researchers compare results across sites external validity. sps_estimator aggregate site-specific ATE estimates estimate average-site ATE. , use experimental estimates selected 6 sites Naumann et al (2018). Users need obtain point estimates standard errors average treatment effects (ATEs) site. aggregate site-specific ATEs selected sites estimate average-site ATE. Finally, users can use site-level cross-validation assess influence unobserved moderators. particular, users can randomly choose half selected sites unobserved non-selected sites predict average ATE non-selected sites based remaining selected sites. null hypothesis predicted ATEs observed ATEs. example, estimated p-value 0.97, find evidence bias due unobserved moderators.
code: data("exp_estimate_Imm_selected") exp_estimate_Imm_selected ##     Estimate         se ## NO 0.2685040 0.02555942 ## FR 0.2751970 0.02201039 ## DE 0.3362153 0.01635270 ## ES 0.2831690 0.02368973 ## CH 0.2857338 0.02715871 ## CZ 0.2210802 0.01993582 sps_est <- sps_estimator(out = out, estimates_selected = exp_estimate_Imm_selected)  summary(sps_est) ##  ##   Estimate Std. Error CI Lower  CI Upper p value     ##  0.2816856  0.0178333 0.246733 0.3166383       0 *** ## --- ## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 sps_cv_out <- sps_cv(out = out, estimates_selected = exp_estimate_Imm_selected) round(sps_cv_out$p_value, 2) ## [1] 0.97

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling
text: Description: R package sps implements SPS algorithm site selection SPS estimator. Authors: Naoki Egami (Maintainer) Diana Da Lee Reference: Egami Lee. (2023+). Designing Multi-Context Studies External Validity: Site Selection via Synthetic Purposive Sampling.

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling
text: can install recent development version using devtools package. First install devtools using following code. Note : , load devtools use function install_github() install spsR:
code: if(!require(devtools)) install.packages("spsR") library(devtools) install_github("naoki-egami/spsR", dependencies = TRUE)

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
code: sps(   X,   N_s,   stratify = NULL,   lambda = c(1, 1, 0.05),   site_selected = NULL,   site_unavailable = NULL,   seed = 1234 )

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
text: X Site-level covariates target population sites N_s Number study sites selected stratify Stratify lambda site_selected site_unavailable seed Numeric. `seed` used internally. Default = 1234.

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
text: sps returns object sps class.  ss: Estimated external robustness. W: Estimates pAMCE factors bootstrap sample. obj: Estimated values objective function X: X Q: Q N: N N_s: N_s ...: Values internal use.

title: Synthetic Purposive Sampling: Site Selection for External Validity — sps
text: Egami Lee. (2023+). Designing Multi-Context Studies External Validity: Site Selection via Synthetic Purposive Sampling. Available https://naokiegami.com/paper/sps.pdf.
